DS3 Manual
DS3: A System-Level Domain-Specific System-on-ChipSimulationFramework
CP_models.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 '''!
2 @brief This file contains the code for dynamic scheduling with Constraint Programming.
3 
4 CP is one of the schedulers develop in DS3.
5 The Constraint Programming model is executed after every frame (job) is generated.
6 The obtained schedule is stored in a table and then used as the tasks become ready for execution.
7 '''
8 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
9 import csv
10 from docplex.cp.model import *
11 import docplex.cp.utils_visu as visu
12 from docplex.cp.config import context
13 import docplex.cp.parameters as params
14 import common
15 
16 def CP(env_time, P_elems, resource_matrix, domain_applications, generated_jobs):
17  '''!
18  Creates a schedule using the Constraint Programming model
19  @param env_time: Current time of the simulation environment
20  @param P_elems: Instances of processing elements in the SoC configuration generated in the simulation environment
21  @param resource_matrix: All processing elements in the SoC configuration
22  @param domain_applications: Applications under consideration for workload generation
23  @param generated_jobs: Instances of applications (jobs) currently being executed in the system
24  '''
25 
26  plt.close('all')
27 
28  # Set docplex related parameters
29  context.solver.trace_log = False
30  #params.CpoParameters.OptimalityTolerance = 2
31  #params.CpoParameters.RelativeOptimalityTolerance= 2
32 
33  Dags = []
34  Dags_2 = {}
35  # Get the task in Outstanding and Ready Queues
36  # Since tasks in Completed Queue are already done, they will not be considered
37  for task in common.TaskQueues.outstanding.list:
38  if task.jobID not in Dags:
39  Dags.append(task.jobID)
40  for i in range(len(domain_applications.list)):
41  name = domain_applications.list[i].name
42  if name == task.jobname:
43  Dags_2[task.jobID] = {}
44  Dags_2[task.jobID]['selection'] = i
45  for task in common.TaskQueues.ready.list:
46  if task.jobID not in Dags:
47  Dags.append(task.jobID)
48  for i in range(len(domain_applications.list)):
49  name = domain_applications.list[i].name
50  if name == task.jobname:
51  Dags_2[task.jobID] = {}
52  Dags_2[task.jobID]['selection'] = i
53  #Dags.sort()
54 
55  common.ilp_job_list = [(key,Dags_2[key]['selection']) for key in Dags_2.keys()]
56  #print(Dags_2)
57 
58 
59  NbDags = len(Dags) # Current number of jobs in the system
60  PEs = [] # List of PE element in the given SoC configuration
61 
62  print('[I] Time %d: There is %d job(s) in the system' %(env_time, NbDags) )
63  print('[D] Time %d: ID of the jobs in the system are' %(env_time),Dags)
64 
65 
66 
67  # First, check if there are any tasks currently being executed on a PE
68  # if yes, retrieve remaining time of execution on that PE and
69  # do not assign a task during ILP solution
70  for i, PE in enumerate(P_elems):
71  if (PE.type == 'MEM') or (PE.type == 'CAC') : # Do not consider Memory ond Cache
72  continue
73  PEs.append(PE.name) # Populate the name of the PEs in the SoC
74  #print(PEs)
75 
76  for ID in Dags_2.keys():
77  Dags_2[ID]['Tasks'] = [] # list of tasks that CPLEX will return a schedule for
78  Dags_2[ID]['Functionality'] = [] # list of task-PE relationship
79  Dags_2[ID]['Con_Precedence'] = [] # list of task dependencies
80 
81  app_id = Dags_2[ID]['selection']
82  #print(len(Dags), len(self.generated_job_list))
83  num_of_tasks = len(domain_applications.list[app_id].task_list)
84 
85  for task in domain_applications.list[app_id].task_list:
86  Dags_2[ID]['Tasks'].append(task.base_ID)
87 
88  # Next, gather the information about which PE can run which Tasks
89  # and if so, the expected execution time
90  for resource in resource_matrix.list:
91  if (resource.type == 'MEM') or (resource.type == 'CAC') : # Do not consider Memory ond Cache
92  continue
93  else:
94  if task.name in resource.supported_functionalities:
95  ind = resource.supported_functionalities.index(task.name)
96  #Functionality.append((resource.name, task.base_ID, resource.performance[ind]))
97  Dags_2[ID]['Functionality'].append((resource.name, task.base_ID, resource.performance[ind]))
98 
99  # Finally, gather dependency information between tasks
100 
101  for i,predecessor in enumerate(task.predecessors):
102  #print(task.ID, predecessor, num_of_tasks, last_ID, task.base_ID)
103 
104  for resource in resource_matrix.list:
105  if (resource.type == 'MEM') or (resource.type == 'CAC') :
106  continue
107  else:
108  #pred_name = self.generated_job_list[job_ind].task_list[predecessor-last_ID].name
109  pred_name = domain_applications.list[app_id].task_list[ predecessor- (task.ID - task.base_ID) ].name
110  if (pred_name in resource.supported_functionalities):
111  c_vol = domain_applications.list[app_id].comm_vol[predecessor - (task.ID - task.base_ID), task.base_ID]
112  Dags_2[ID]['Con_Precedence'].append((resource.name,Dags_2[ID]['Tasks'][predecessor - (task.ID - task.base_ID)], task.base_ID, c_vol))
113 
114  #print(Dags_2[ID]['Tasks'])
115  #print(len(Dags_2[ID]['Functionality']))
116  #print(Dags_2[ID]['Con_Precedence'])
117 
118 
119 
120 
121  mdl = CpoModel()
122 
123  # Create dag interval variables
124  dags = { d : mdl.interval_var(name="dag"+str(d)) for d in Dags_2.keys()}
125  #print(dags)
126 
127  # Create tasks interval variables and pe_tasks interval variables
128  # pe_tasks are optional and only one of them will be mapped to the corresponding
129  # tasks interval variable
130  # For example, task_1 has 3 pe_tasks (i.e.,P1-task_1, P2-task_1, P3, task_1)
131  # only of these will be selected. If the first one is selected, it means that task_1 will be executed in P1
132  tasks_2 = {}
133  pe_tasks_2 = {}
134  task_names_ids_2 = {}
135  last_ID = 0
136  for d in Dags_2.keys():
137  num_of_tasks = len(generated_jobs[d].task_list)
138  for t in Dags_2[d]['Tasks']:
139  tasks_2[(d,t)] = mdl.interval_var(name = str(d)+"_"+str(t))
140  for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality']:
141  #print(f)
142  name = str(d)+"_"+str(f[1])+'-'+str(f[0])
143  if len(common.TaskQueues.running.list) == 0 and len(common.TaskQueues.completed.list) == 0:
144  pe_tasks_2[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, size =int(f[2]), name = name )
145  task_names_ids_2[name] = last_ID+f[1]
146  else:
147  for ii, running_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.running.list):
148  if (d == running_task.jobID) and (f[1] == running_task.base_ID) and (f[0] == P_elems[running_task.PE_ID].name):
149 
150  ind = resource_matrix.list[running_task.PE_ID].supported_functionalities.index(running_task.name)
151  exec_time = resource_matrix.list[running_task.PE_ID].performance[ind]
152  free_time = int(running_task.start_time + exec_time - env_time)
153  #print(free_time)
154  pe_tasks_2[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, start=0, end=free_time,name = name )
155  task_names_ids_2[name] = last_ID+f[1]
156  break
157  elif (d == running_task.jobID) and (f[1] == running_task.base_ID):
158  pe_tasks_2[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, size =INTERVAL_MAX, name = name )
159  task_names_ids_2[name] = last_ID+f[1]
160  break
161  else:
162  pe_tasks_2[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, size =int(f[2]), name = name )
163  task_names_ids_2[name] = last_ID+f[1]
164 
165  for iii, completed_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.completed.list):
166  if (d == completed_task.jobID) and (f[1] == completed_task.base_ID) and (f[0] == P_elems[completed_task.PE_ID].name):
167  #print(completed_task.name)
168  #pe_tasks[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, size =0, name = name )
169  pe_tasks_2[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, start=0, end=0, name = name )
170  task_names_ids_2[name] = last_ID+f[1]
171  elif (d == completed_task.jobID) and (f[1] == completed_task.base_ID):
172  pe_tasks_2[(d,f)] = mdl.interval_var(optional=True, size =INTERVAL_MAX, name = name )
173  task_names_ids_2[name] = last_ID+f[1]
174  #print('3',pe_tasks[(d,f)])
175 
176  last_ID += num_of_tasks
177  #print(tasks_2)
178  #print(task_names_ids_2)
179 
180  # Add the temporal constraints
181  for d in Dags_2.keys():
182  for c in Dags_2[d]['Con_Precedence']:
183  for (p1, task1, d1) in Dags_2[d]['Functionality']:
184  if p1 == c[0] and task1 == c[1]:
185  p1_id = PEs.index(p1)
186  for (p2, task2, d2) in Dags_2[d]['Functionality']:
187  if p2 == c[0] and task2 == c[2]:
188  mdl.add( mdl.end_before_start(pe_tasks_2[d,(p1,task1,d1)], pe_tasks_2[d,(p2,task2,d2)], 0) )
189  elif p2 != c[0] and task2 == c[2]:
190  p2_id = PEs.index(p2)
191  #print(p2_id)
192  bandwidth = common.ResourceManager.comm_band[p1_id,p2_id]
193  comm_time = int( (c[3])/bandwidth )
194  for ii, completed_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.completed.list):
195  if ((d == completed_task.jobID) and (task1 == completed_task.base_ID) and (p1 == P_elems[completed_task.PE_ID].name)):
196  mdl.add( mdl.end_before_start(pe_tasks_2[d,(p1,task1,d1)], pe_tasks_2[d,(p2,task2,d2)], max(0,comm_time+completed_task.finish_time-env_time) ))
197  #print (d, p1,p2, task1,task2, max(0,int(c[3])+completed_task.finish_time-self.env.now) )
198  break
199  else:
200  #print(d, p1,p2, task1,task2, c[3])
201  mdl.add( mdl.end_before_start(pe_tasks_2[d,(p1,task1,d1)], pe_tasks_2[d,(p2,task2,d2)], comm_time ) )
202 
203 
204  # Add the span constraints
205  # This constraint enables to identify tasks in a dag
206  for d in Dags_2.keys():
207  mdl.add( mdl.span(dags[d], [tasks_2[(d,t)] for t in Dags_2[d]['Tasks'] ] ) )
208 
209 
210  # Add the alternative constraints
211  # This constraint ensures that only one PE is chosen to execute a particular task
212  for d in Dags_2.keys():
213  for t in Dags_2[d]['Tasks']:
214  mdl.add( mdl.alternative(tasks_2[d,t], [pe_tasks_2[d,f] for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality'] if f[1]==t]) )
215 
216 
217  # Add the no overlap constraints
218  # This constraint ensures that there will be no overlap for the task being executed on the same PE
219  for p in PEs:
220  b_list = [pe_tasks_2[d,f] for d in Dags_2.keys() for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality'] if f[0]==p]
221  if b_list:
222  mdl.add( mdl.no_overlap([pe_tasks_2[d,f] for d in Dags_2.keys() for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality'] if f[0]==p]))
223  else:
224  continue
225 
226  # Add the objective
227  mdl.add(mdl.minimize(mdl.sum([mdl.end_of(dags[d]) for i,d in enumerate(Dags)])))
228  #mdl.add(mdl.minimize(mdl.max([mdl.end_of(pe_tasks_2[(d,f)]) for i,d in enumerate(Dags) for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality'] ])))
229  #mdl.add(mdl.minimize(mdl.max(mdl.end_of(dags[d]) for i,d in enumerate(Dags))))
230 
231 
233  print("\nSolving CP model....")
234  msol = mdl.solve(TimeLimit = 60)
235  #msol = mdl.solve()
236  #print("Completed")
237 
238  #print(msol.print_solution())
239  #print(msol.is_solution_optimal())
240  print(msol.get_objective_gaps())
241  print(msol.get_objective_values()[0])
242 
243 
244  tem_list = []
245  for d in Dags:
246  #for f in Functionality:
247  for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality']:
248  #solution = msol.get_var_solution(pe_tasks[(d,f)])
249  solution = msol.get_var_solution(pe_tasks_2[(d,f)])
250  if solution.is_present():
251  #ID = task_names_ids[solution.get_name()]
252  ID = task_names_ids_2[solution.get_name()]
253  tem_list.append( (ID, f[0], solution.get_start(), solution.get_end()) )
254  tem_list.sort(key=lambda x: x[2], reverse=False)
255  #print(tem_list)
256 
257  actual_schedule = []
258  for i,p in enumerate(PEs):
259  count = 0
260  for item in tem_list:
261  if item[1] == p:
262  actual_schedule.append( (item[0],i,count+1))
263  count += 1
264  actual_schedule.sort(key=lambda x: x[0], reverse=False)
265  #print(actual_schedule)
266 
267  common.table = []
268  for element in actual_schedule:
269  common.table.append((element[1],element[2]))
270  #print(common.table)
271  #print(len(common.table))
272 
273 
274  if (common.simulation_mode == 'validation'):
275  colors = ['salmon','turquoise', 'lime' , 'coral', 'lightpink']
276  PEs.reverse()
277  for i,p in enumerate(PEs):
278  #visu.panel()
279  #visu.pause(PE_busy_times[p])
280  visu.sequence(name=p)
281 
282  for ii,d in enumerate(Dags):
283  #for f in Functionality:
284  for f in Dags_2[d]['Functionality']:
285  #wt = msol.get_var_solution(pe_tasks[(d,f)])
286  wt = msol.get_var_solution(pe_tasks_2[(d,f)])
287  if wt.is_present() and p == f[0]:
288  color = colors[ii%len(colors)]
289  #visu.interval(wt, color, str(task_names_ids[wt.get_name()]))
290  visu.interval(wt, color, str(task_names_ids_2[wt.get_name()]))
291  visu.show()
292 
293 
294  for d in Dags:
295  for task in generated_jobs[d].task_list:
296 
297  task_sched_ID = 0
298  task.dynamic_dependencies.clear() # Clear dependencies from previosu ILP run
299 
300  ind = Dags.index(d)
301  for i in range(ind):
302  selection = Dags_2[Dags[i]]['selection']
303  task_sched_ID += len(domain_applications.list[selection].task_list)
304  task_sched_ID += task.base_ID
305 
306  task_order = common.table[task_sched_ID][1]
307 
308  for k in Dags:
309 
310  for dyn_depend in generated_jobs[k].task_list:
311  dyn_depend_sched_ID = 0
312 
313  ind_k = Dags.index(k)
314  for ii in range(ind_k):
315  selection = Dags_2[Dags[ii]]['selection']
316  dyn_depend_sched_ID += len(domain_applications.list[selection].task_list)
317  dyn_depend_sched_ID += dyn_depend.base_ID
318 
319  if ( (common.table[dyn_depend_sched_ID][0] == common.table[task_sched_ID][0]) and
320  (common.table[dyn_depend_sched_ID][1] == task_order-1) and
321  (dyn_depend.ID not in task.predecessors) and
322  (dyn_depend.ID not in task.dynamic_dependencies) ):
323 
324  task.dynamic_dependencies.append(dyn_depend.ID)
325  #print(task.ID, task.dynamic_dependencies)
326 
327 # end of CP_Multi(......

CP_models.CP
def CP(env_time, P_elems, resource_matrix, domain_applications, generated_jobs)
Creates a schedule using the Constraint Programming model.
